definition: canvass for contributions/to recruit/to collect/to raise

sentences.english: We're having a whip-round for old Fred , who's leaving the firm.
sentences.chinese: 我們正在爲即將從公司退休的老弗雷德進行募捐。

sentences.english: Tell them about the progress you have made towards reaching your fundraising goals.
sentences.chinese: 告訴他們你爲了達到募捐目標而進行的努力。

sentences.english: We started a campaign for money-raising for the flooded area-Pakistan.
sentences.chinese: 我們發起了一個爲洪災地區募捐的活動。

sentences.english: He suggested he could start sifting through the requests for money and give some out.
sentences.chinese: 他建議蓋茨可以開始篩選募捐請求，並捐出一部分錢。

sentences.english: A Blue Box is not just a pushke into which coins are put.
sentences.chinese: 一個募捐箱絕不僅僅是一個用來投放硬幣的箱子。

sentences.english: I guess they passed the hat.
They decided to raise the money by subscription.
sentences.chinese: 他們決定靠募捐的辦法來籌集這筆款子。

sentences.english: She even began doing public speaking to raise support for Fisher House.
sentences.chinese: 她甚至開始做公共演講，爲漁人之家募捐。

sentences.english: We re collecting for victims of the earthquake-stricken area, please give generously.
sentences.chinese: 我們在爲地震災區的災民募捐，請慷慨捐助。

sentences.english: He canvassed among the students and their parents for contributions.
sentences.chinese: 他在學生和家長中進行募捐。

sentences.english: What happened to the collection in Acts? We don't know.
sentences.chinese: 使徒行傳裏的募捐哪裏去了，我們不知道。

sentences.english: He will write off the charitable contributions from his income taxes.
sentences.chinese: 他從所得稅中扣除了慈善募捐的金額。

sentences.english: A piece of freeware I've been using asks for a $40 donation.
sentences.chinese: 我正在使用的一個免費軟件請求獲得40美元的募捐。

sentences.english: We're having a whip-round for old Fred, who's retiring from the firm.
sentences.chinese: 我們正在爲即將從公司退休的老弗雷德進行募捐。

sentences.english: They were going to stage a large-scale money collecting.
sentences.chinese: 他們籌劃舉辦一個大型募捐活動。

definition: to donate money/to contribute funds/donation/contribution (of money)
to donate goods (to a relief effort)/to contribute material
to contribute generously (idiom); help sb generously with money/to give generously to charity
